data.text:
Biography

Andrea Ferro is a professor in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering at Clarkson University in Potsdam, NY. Her technical expertise is focused on indoor air quality and human exposure to particulate pollutants. She has also worked in the private industry, engineering consulting and non-profit sectors. The overall goal of Prof. Ferro’s work is to improve human health by improving air quality through source control, ventilation and purification strategies, education, and regulatory policy. Dr. Ferro is currently the PI for NSF ADVANCE project called Strategic Partnership for Alignment of Community Engagement in STEM (SPACES). She is a recent past president of the American Association for Aerosol Research (AAAR) and a Fellow of the International Society of Indoor Air Quality and Climate (ISIAQ).

Teaching Interests

Registration

Registered Professional Engineer, State of Massachusetts

Teaching

Dr. Ferro teaches undergraduate and graduate courses in environmental engineering, sustainable development, air pollution, and human exposure analysis. She is the faculty co-advisor for the Clarkson student chapter of the American Association for Aerosol Research (AAAR).

Research Interests

Dr. Ferro's research interests are in the areas of indoor air quality, fate and transport of pollutants in the built environment, resuspension of particulate matter, respiratory aerosol emissions, and community-engaged research to address impacts of climate change and pollutant exposure.
